Procedural_Stage: Appeal from Trade-marks Opposition Board decision
Evidence_Assessment: Limited evidence of actual confusion due to geographical separation
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant (Nature's Source Inc.) to establish registrability
Legal_Rule: Likelihood of confusion assessed by distinctiveness, length of use, nature of wares/services, trade channels, and resemblance in appearance/sound/ideas
Grounds_for_Claim: Opposition based on likelihood of confusion with existing 'Natursource' mark
Outcome_on_Merits: Boardâ€™s finding of likelihood of confusion was reasonable
Decision_Maker: Trade-marks Opposition Board; Federal Court on appeal
Key_Evidence_Considered: Length of use, distinctiveness, phonetic/visual resemblance, nature of services, trade channels
Applicant_Challenge: Nature's Source Inc.'s application for 'Nature's Source' opposed by Natursource Inc.
Court_Result: Federal Court dismissed appeal with costs
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, use history, market overlap
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative opposition followed by judicial review
Claimant_Status: Nature's Source Inc. as applicant; Natursource Inc. as opponent
Governing_Rule: Trademark Act, s.6(5): Test for likelihood of confusion
